issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I can't create a topic.
I can't post a comment.
It gives "Error, Post content was flagged as spam by Akismet.com" for any message entered.

comments.body:
Hello,

1. First check if there is already a submitted post of yours. 
2. Check if there is already a content posted in there when you click submit and it's maybe trying to post another same content.  
3. Try disabling Askimet.com anti-spam plugin in your browser, if you have that. I would  recommend disable Askimet and enable the other spam filters instead.

Hope this helps, Thanks.

Hi

bq. 1. First check if there is already a submitted post of yours.
1. How to do that?
2. What to do next in case I haven't a post?
3. What to do next in case I have a post?

bq. 2. Check if there is already a content posted in there when you click submit and it's maybe trying to post another same content.
I'm not sure I understand what you mean. I just enter a text as usual and press the submit button then. Nothing special.

bq. 3. Try disabling Askimet.com anti-spam plugin in your browser ...
Are you kidding me? Please, stop do that. The askimet is integrated into your web site, not into my browser:
!akismet.jpg|thumbnail!

Hello, FYI, We are embracing Stack Overflow for Appcelerator Community Support. You are not able to create new topics any longer, only reply (e.g. with a link to your question as you've copied it to Stack Overflow). On February 1st the Q&A will be discontinued. Thanks.

As usual, you (not you personally, but the team) are doing things in a completely wrong way and don't care about your community and customers.
You've flushed down the toilet "google-searchable" community data accumulated for several years.
